Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The United States Air Force (USAF) Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) SSJ precipitating particle instrument measures in-situ total flux and energy distribution of electrons and ions at low earth orbit. These precipitating particles are of interest for space weather operations and research, in part because they produce aurora during normal and very strong geomagnetic storms. This dataset contains both sensor-level raw data (as detailed in Redmon et al. 2017) and a high-level machine-learning-ready data product.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The United States Air Force (USAF) Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) SSJ precipitating particle instrument measures in-situ total flux and energy distribution of electrons and ions at low earth orbit. These precipitating particles are of interest for space weather operations and research, in part because they produce aurora during normal and very strong geomagnetic storms. This dataset contains both sensor-level raw data (as detailed in Redmon et al. 2017) and a high-level machine-learning-ready data product.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
We run our own data processing system.
But we will download the dataset according to the AWS command line:
Resources on AWS
Description
DMSP Auroral Particle Flux
Resource type
S3 Bucket
Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
arn:aws:s3:::dmspssj
AWS Region
us-west-2
AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://dmspssj/
